00042 static inline unsigned long long rthal_ullmul(const unsigned long m0, 
00043                                               const unsigned long m1)
00044 {
00045     return (unsigned long long) m0 * m1;
00046 }
00047 
00048 static inline unsigned long long rthal_ulldiv (unsigned long long ull,
00049                                                const unsigned long uld,
00050                                                unsigned long *const rp)
00051 {
00052     const unsigned long r = ull % uld;
00053     ull /= uld;
00054 
00055     if (rp)
00056         *rp = r;
00057 
00058     return ull;
00059 }
00060 
00061 #define rthal_uldivrem(ull,ul,rp) ((u_long) rthal_ulldiv((ull),(ul),(rp)))
00062 
00063 static inline int rthal_imuldiv (int i, int mult, int div) {
00064 
00065     /* Returns (int)i = (unsigned long long)i*(u_long)(mult)/(u_long)div. */
00066     const unsigned long long ull = rthal_ullmul(i, mult);
00067     return rthal_uldivrem(ull, div, NULL);
00068 }
00069 
00070 static inline __attribute_const__
00071 unsigned long long __rthal_ullimd (const unsigned long long op,
00072                                    const unsigned long m,
00073                                    const unsigned long d)
00074 {
00075         return (op*m)/d;
00076 }
00077 
00078 static inline long long rthal_llimd (long long op,
00079                                      unsigned long m,
00080                                      unsigned long d)
00081 {
00082 
00083     if(op < 0LL)
00084         return -__rthal_ullimd(-op, m, d);
00085     return __rthal_ullimd(op, m, d);
00086 }
00087 
00088 static inline  __attribute_const__ unsigned long ffnz (unsigned long ul) {
00089 
00090     __asm__ ("cntlzd %0, %1" : "=r" (ul) : "r" (ul & (-ul)));
00091     return 63 - ul;
00092 }

00105 static inline unsigned long long rthal_rdtsc (void) {
00106     unsigned long long t;
00107     rthal_read_tsc(t);

00111 #if defined(CONFIG_ADEOS_CORE) && !defined(CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS)
00112 
00113 /* Since real-time interrupt handlers are called on behalf of the
00114    Xenomai domain stack, we cannot infere the "current" Linux task
00115    address using %esp. We must use the suspended Linux domain's stack
00116    pointer instead. */
00117 
00118 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_root_host_task (int cpuid) {
00119     return ((struct thread_info *)(rthal_root_domain->esp[cpuid] & (~(16384-1)UL)))->task;
00120 }
00121 
00122 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_current_host_task (int cpuid)
00123 
00124 {
00125     register unsigned long esp asm ("r1");
00126     
00127     if (esp >= rthal_domain.estackbase[cpuid] && esp < rthal_domain.estackbase[cpuid] + 16384)
00128         return rthal_root_host_task(cpuid);
00129 
00130     return current;
00131 }
00132 
00133 #else /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_CORE || CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS */
00134 
00135 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_root_host_task (int cpuid) {
00136     return current;
00137 }
00138 
00139 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_current_host_task (int cpuid) {
00140     return current;
00141 }
00142 
00143 #endif /* CONFIG_ADEOS_CORE && !CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS */

00145 static inline void rthal_timer_program_shot (unsigned long delay)
00146 {
00147     if(!delay) delay = 1;
00148     set_dec(delay);
00149 }

00160 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00161 
00162 typedef struct rthal_fpenv {
00163     
00164     /* This layout must follow exactely the definition of the FPU
00165        backup area in a PPC thread struct available from
00166        <asm-ppc/processor.h>. Specifically, fpr[] an fpscr words must
00167        be contiguous in memory (see arch/ppc/hal/fpu.S). */
00168 
00169     double fpr[32];
00170     unsigned long fpscr;       /* mffs uses 64-bit (pad in hi/fpscr in lo) */
00171 } rthal_fpenv_t;
00172 
00173 void rthal_init_fpu(rthal_fpenv_t *fpuenv);
00174 
00175 void rthal_save_fpu(rthal_fpenv_t *fpuenv);
00176 
00177 void rthal_restore_fpu(rthal_fpenv_t *fpuenv);

00179 #ifndef CONFIG_SMP
00180 #define rthal_get_fpu_owner(cur) last_task_used_math
00181 #else /* CONFIG_SMP */
00182 #define rthal_get_fpu_owner(cur) ({                             \
00183     struct task_struct * _cur = (cur);                          \
00184     ((_cur->thread.regs && (_cur->thread.regs->msr & MSR_FP))   \
00185      ? _cur : NULL);                                            \
00186 })
00187 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00188     
00189 #define rthal_disable_fpu() ({                          \
00190     register unsigned long _msr;                                 \
00191     __asm__ __volatile__ ( "mfmsr %0" : "=r"(_msr) );   \
00192     __asm__ __volatile__ ( "mtmsrd %0"                   \
00193                            : /* no output */            \
00194                            : "r"(_msr & ~(MSR_FP))      \
00195                            : "memory" );                \
00196 })
00197 
00198 #define rthal_enable_fpu() ({                           \
00199     register unsigned long _msr;                                 \
00200     __asm__ __volatile__ ( "mfmsr %0" : "=r"(_msr) );   \
00201     __asm__ __volatile__ ( "mtmsrd %0"                   \
00202                            : /* no output */            \
00203                            : "r"(_msr | MSR_FP)         \
00204                            : "memory" );                \
00205 })
00206 
00207 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
